meta.title: Positano to Amalfi by Ferry | Hostel Brikette
meta.description: Step-by-step ferry trip from Positano to Amalfi: where to board at Spiaggia Grande, tickets, live schedules, and a simple Plan B if the sea cancels the boats.

hero.title: Positano to Amalfi — Ferry
hero.description: Take the scenic ferry from Positano to Amalfi. This guide covers tickets, boarding at Spiaggia Grande, arrival logistics in Amalfi, and what to do if boats cancel.

tip.label: Tip
tip.copy: Need other transport options? Open the <link>How to Get Here overview</link> for buses, mixed routes, and airport transfers.

overview.title: Journey overview
points: Ferries are seasonal (typically spring–early autumn) and weather-dependent.
In peak season, services can sell out and queues build at Spiaggia Grande — arrive early.
If the sea is rough and boats pause, switch to the bus as a Plan B.

tickets.title: Tickets and schedules
tickets.intro: Check latest times and prices on <travelmar>Travelmar</travelmar> and <positano>Positano.com — Ferry schedules</positano>. For a quick explainer (operators, seasons, and common pitfalls), see <ferrySchedules>our ferry schedules guide</ferrySchedules>.
points: In high season, buy online in advance (especially afternoons) or at operator booths along the waterfront.
Arrive 20–30 minutes before departure so you can queue calmly and exchange vouchers if required.
Screenshot your QR code — signal can be patchy by the beach and pier.
If you’re travelling with large luggage, ask staff about luggage rules and where to stow bags on board.

gettingToPier.title: Getting to the pier from Hostel Brikette
gettingToPier.intro: If you’re starting at the hostel, use <dockWalk>our step-by-step walk to the ferry dock</dockWalk> to reach Spiaggia Grande without guesswork.
points: Leave buffer time for stairs, heat, and slow-moving foot traffic in town.
Carry water and keep essentials (passport/wallet/phone) in an easy-to-reach pocket for boarding checks.

positanoPier.title: Where to board in Positano
points: Departures are from Positano’s main pier on Spiaggia Grande.
Operator booths line the waterfront; boards and staff will direct you to the next departure for each company.
Double-check the operator and destination on your ticket — ask staff if you’re unsure which line to join.

amalfiArrival.title: Arriving in Amalfi
points: Boats arrive at Amalfi’s waterfront piers near Piazza Flavio Gioia.
The historic center is right next to the port — it’s an easy walk to the Duomo and main piazza.
For onward buses (e.g., Ravello or Salerno), follow signs to the SITA stop near the waterfront and confirm the queue.

planB.title: If the ferry cancels (Plan B that works)
planB.intro: On windy days, the sea can pause the boats. Don’t panic — switch to the <bus>Positano → Amalfi bus</bus>, and skim <cancellations>our ferry cancellations guide</cancellations> for timing and troubleshooting.
points: If you’re already at the beach, walk back up to the main road and take the next available bus or taxi.
Build buffer time: buses can arrive full in peak months, and delays are normal.
If you’re travelling late, confirm the last viable departure early (ferry or bus) so you’re not stranded.
